com.bericotech.clavin.util
Class DamerauLevenshtein

java.lang.Object
  com.bericotech.clavin.util.DamerauLevenshtein

public class DamerauLevenshtein
extends Object

Utility functions for calculating edit distance between strings, consistent with the Damerau-Levenshtein metric. Transposition, substitution, insertion, and deletion operations are all considered to be one edit each. Multiple substring edits (e.g., adjacent transpositions) are supported, unlike in "optimal string alignment distance" where no substring may be edited more than once.

isEditDistance1

public static boolean isEditDistance1(String str1,
                                      String str2)
Fast method for determining whether the Damerau-Levenshtein edit distance between two strings is less than 2. Returns as quick as possibly by stopping once multiple edits are found. Significantly faster than damerauLevenshteinDistance(String str1, String str2) which explores every path between every string to get the exact edit distance. Despite the speed boost, we maintain consistency with damerauLevenshteinDistance(String str1, String str2).

Parameters:
str1 - First string being compared
str2 - Second string being compared
Returns:
True if DL edit distance < 2, false otherwise
